intro: Micropera callosa, commonly known as the hairy micropera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets. Micropera callosa is often found in rocky areas and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
